skill.name: etetoolkit
skill.description: Phylogenetic tree toolkit (ETE). Tree manipulation (Newick/NHX), evolutionary event detection, orthology/paralogy, NCBI taxonomy, visualization (PDF/SVG), for phylogenomics.
skill.summary: Phylogenetic tree toolkit (ETE). Tree manipulation (Newick/NHX), evolutionary event detection, ortho...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns were found. Scripts operate on user provided tree files and write local outputs only.

content.value_statement: Phylogenetic tree processing is slow without reliable tooling. This skill provides scripts and guidance for fast conversion, rooting, and visualization.
actual_capabilities: Convert Newick trees between formats with a CLI helper
Reroot trees by midpoint or named outgroup
Prune trees to a taxa list from text or comma input
Generate tree statistics and list leaf names
Render PNG, PDF, or SVG trees with layout and styling options
limitations: Requires the ete3 Python package to be installed
Works only with valid Newick input files
Rendering may require optional GUI dependencies for full features
Does not infer phylogenies from sequence data

use_cases.title: Clean and reroot trees
use_cases.description: Convert and reroot many gene trees before downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Quick tree checks
use_cases.description: Get statistics and ASCII previews to validate tree files.

use_cases.title: Publishable figures
use_cases.description: Render styled PDF or SVG trees for manuscripts.

prompt_templates.title: Convert tree format
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert input.nw to output.nw using format 1 and the tree_operations script.

prompt_templates.title: Midpoint reroot
prompt_templates.prompt: Reroot tree.nw using midpoint rooting and save as rooted.nw.

prompt_templates.title: Prune taxa list
prompt_templates.prompt: Prune tree.nw to taxa sp1, sp2, sp3 and write pruned.nw preserving branch lengths.

prompt_templates.title: Styled visualization
prompt_templates.prompt: Render tree.nw to figure.pdf in circular mode with support coloring and a title.

output_examples.input: Show statistics for my tree and list the leaves
output: Number of leaves and total nodes
Tree depth and farthest leaf name

best_practices: Verify Newick format numbers before converting
Use midpoint rooting only when no clear outgroup exists
Render SVG or PDF for publication figures
anti_patterns: Pruning without preserving branch lengths when topology matters

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides scripts and guidance that work in those platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits for tree size?
faq.answer: Large trees are supported, but memory use depends on your system.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the CLI scripts can be called from shell or workflow tools.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No, it only reads files you specify and writes local outputs.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot render failures?
faq.answer: Install ete3 and required GUI dependencies, then retry the render.

faq.question: How does it compare to other tree tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on ETE workflows with lightweight CLI helpers and visualization.
